meanings.definition: To intimidate or dominate through aggressive behavior.
meanings.sent1: The big kid tried to outbully the smaller children on the playground.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outbully his classmates to get his way.
meanings.sent3: The little dog tried to outbully the big dog, thinking he was tough.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, companies often try to outbully each other to gain dominance.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the movie tried to outbully the hero, but justice prevailed in the end.

meanings.sent1: She managed to outbully her rival by spreading rumors about her.
meanings.sent2: The aggressive student always tries to outbully others to show his power.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outbully the dog, but the dog just wagged its tail.
meanings.sent4: In the animal kingdom, some species outbully others to establish dominance.
meanings.sent5: The bully thought he could outbully everyone, but he met his match in the new kid.
